text: Don't post your own referral codes here  especially when there is already a post on it
Just want to confirm EVERYONE can top up their medisave in Jan 2024 to reach $71 500 in order to enjoy tax relief of up to $8k.Even people with FRS and ERS?
For UOB one card  how do I hit 7.8% ? I did spent $500 in a month n credit my salary and have 100k in my account. But I only got about 5% monthly
Are you referring to the UOB one account? 7.8% is only for the 25k between 75k and 100k
So the EIR on total of 100k deposit is 5%
How do I maximise to 7.8%?
The EIR for the UOB One account can never be 7.8%  it's not possible. Best you can possibly do is 6.x% by stacking with UOB earmark promo
Oh I see  then why did they even advertise 7.8% when is not possible? I thought I did not hit one of their criteria for to hit the max of 7.8%
Advertising? But pls read T&Cs of things  don't just look at the headline
As he said  this is what he meant.

Is that why inflation rate is so high? Cos a lot of people take advantage of high sums of money and interest to drive up demand for goods and services demand push inflation + cost push inflation of raw materials and ingredients stemming from the 2 wars
It's because fed printed too much money
Gd morning folks  should i use my cpf oa to clear my hdb loan or topup sa acc?
What is the best platform to transfer money to US? Thank you
Hi.If not planning to sell in future  good to topup sa acc instead.. higher amount of oa put into hdb loan  mean higher accural interest per month

Depends on what is your purpose of top up. If for medical needs  MA. If for parents monthly payout  RA. Either way  this top up there is no lump sum withdrawal.

Hi  can citi cashback+ earn cashback for insurance payment?
Hi  what card should i use for dining and drinks at ce la vi? I have instarem+ citi reward miles  hsbc revolution and advance
No  insurance payments do not count towards the $800 monthly minimum spending required for cashback  nor do they qualify for any cashback.

I guess this is really up to you and which card you need to hit minimum spending for? Instarem+Citi rewards is 4 mpd  HSBC revolution also same at 4mpd if you pay contactless via mobile  HSBC advance is just 1.5% cashback or 2.5% if you spend over $2000 in a month... so really up to you
Sometimes don't just trust advertisement as it is. Details are more important
Anyone used Momo 5.8% guranteed return ? Seems safe for 1 month ( recently 2 months)
If I remember correctly  it's better to redeem cashback for Revolution as need to pay annual fee for miles.
hm  dun think just a bit more fee affect the decision to convert to miles or cashback
